qas.question: What system of government was constitution based on?
How long did British military presence remain in Egypt?

context: The new government drafted and implemented a constitution in <a0_0>1923<a0_0/> based on a <a1_0>parliamentary system<a1_0/>. <a2_0>Saad Zaghlul<a2_0/> was popularly elected as Prime Minister of Egypt in 1924. In 1936, the Anglo-Egyptian Treaty was concluded. Continued instability due to remaining British influence and increasing political involvement by the king led to the dissolution of the parliament in a military coup d'état known as the 1952 Revolution. The Free Officers Movement forced King Farouk to abdicate in support of <a3_0>his son Fuad<a3_0/>. British military presence in Egypt lasted until <a4_0>1954<a4_0/>.
